alert.note: Alert for Denton (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 21 at 5:37PM CDT by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Denton County through 615 PM CDT... At 537 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles west of Krum, or 13 miles west of Denton, moving northeast at 5 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Denton, Krum, Ponder, Stony, and Bolivar. This includes the following highways... Interstate 35 between mile markers 468 and 475. Interstate 35W between mile markers 83 and 85. Interstate 35E between mile markers 464 and 466. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
